Data: Swann to Watson, no run oops, Ponting has to put his skates on here to get back at the non-strikers end after Watson clips to midwicket and turns a single down, a good call in the end
Swann to Watson, 1 run worked away behind square for a single
Swann to Ponting, 1 run some turn there for Swann, Ponting clips it behind square to get off the mark
Swann to Watson, no run defended safely outside off
Swann to Watson, no run left alone outside off this time
Swann to Watson, 1 run turns in to a middle-stump line, Watson works it behind square leg again
Broad to Watson, no run a bit of shape away from Watson, who lets it go
Broad to Watson, FOUR runs that's a lovely cut shot, Watson has placed that one nicely just forward of gully and it races away
Broad to Watson, 1 run that is a cracking pull for a single, Watson looked to positively murder that ball, but Bopara at deep midwicket makes an outstanding diving save to keep it to one
Broad to Ponting, no run ah, there's an inside edge from Ponting, who hasn't quite got his eye in yet
Broad to Ponting, no run left alone outside off
Broad to Ponting, no run howzat? Not out, says Koertzen. There was some definite inswing there and Ponting is struck outside the line
Anderson to Watson, no run pushed away defensively to cover
Anderson to Watson, 1 run cut straight down into the turf, they get through for a single
Anderson to Ponting, no run angling in to Ponting, that's how you want to bowl to him early, but Ponting lunges forward to defend
Anderson to Ponting, no run swings this one away, Ponting lets it go
Anderson to Ponting, no run good bounce and carry from Anderson, who moves it away from Ponting and it's left alone
Anderson to Ponting, no run another big step forward and out to off from Ponting, who blocks it away
Broad to Watson, 2 runs straight ball, Watson simply pushes it to midwicket and they scamper through for two, how they had time to get a double there I don't know
Broad to Watson, no run punched defensively to cover
Broad to Watson, no run no shot offered to a ball that shapes away
Broad to Watson, no run left alone outside off again
Broad to Watson, no run good shape away once again, Watson lets it sail by
Broad to Watson, no run good length, Watson defends off the back foot
Anderson to Ponting, FOUR runs crunching back-foot cut through cover-point there, Ponting was given width and was quickly onto it
Anderson to Ponting, no run lunges forward to defend this one
Anderson to Ponting, 1 run groans from England as Ponting drives at this one and gets a thick inside edge between the stumps and his body
Anderson to Watson, no run pushes to off and thinks of a single for the half-century, but then roars a 'no!", sensibly
Anderson to Watson, 2 runs and there's the half-century for Watson with a clip off his pads to mid-on and a misfield lets them get through for a couple
Anderson to Watson, no run defended to off
Flintoff to Ponting, no run a hint of inswing and Ponting defends
Flintoff to Ponting, no run good bounce from Flintoff, Ponting lets it go outside off
Flintoff to Ponting, no run no shot offered outside off again
Flintoff to Ponting, no run 89.5mph or 144kph there from Flintoff, Ponting lets it go
Flintoff to Ponting, no run Flintoff really bending his back here, that bounces a lot and Ponting lets it go
Flintoff to Ponting, FOUR runs well placed by Ponting here, Flintoff tries for the yorker but it's a fraction too full and he drives it wide of mid-on
Anderson to Watson, FOUR runs shouts of 'catch' here as Watson cuts hard, it wasn't very wide of gully at all there, but would have required something magical from Swann to reach it all the same
Anderson to Watson, no run guided down into the ground this time to gully
Anderson to Watson, no run again Watson angles the bat and guides it to gully
Anderson to Watson, no run Anderson continues to probe outside off, Watson bunts it to cover
Anderson to Watson, FOUR runs clipped off his hips nicely to fine-leg for a boundary, that ball was just a bit too straight
Anderson to Watson, no run driven back down to mid-off
Flintoff to Ponting, 1 run a touch straight this time, Ponting works a single to midwicket
Flintoff to Watson, 1 run on the pads again, Watson clips through square leg
Flintoff to Ponting, no run left alone outside off stump this time
Flintoff to Ponting, 1 run Ponting swivels a pull around to fine leg
Flintoff to Watson, no run defended straight back down the pitch
Flintoff to Watson, no run good bounce and carry again, Watson leaves it outside off
Anderson to Ponting, no run just a tad wide. Ergo, left alone
Anderson to Ponting, no run well wide and swinging wider still
Anderson to Ponting, 1 run terrific surprise straighter ball shaping back into Ponting but he plays it well enough, nurdling to leg and getting right forward on the front foot
Anderson to Watson, no run shuffles back to defend, albeit with both feet pointing down the pitch
Anderson to Watson, no run good carry - it's fairly flying through at the moment
Anderson to Watson, 1 run nudged to leg
Flintoff to Watson, no run bouncer down the leg side
Flintoff to Watson, no run too wide and left alone
Flintoff to Watson, 1 run dropped out to the off side for a quick single
Flintoff to Ponting, FOUR runs edged, or steered, past gully - played all along the ground. Sheesh, runs really have flown today

Flintoff to Ponting, no run ooh and that could've flown into gully's hands - again Ponting lunged forward massively, as he does, but it's always dangerous against someone of Flintoff's height. Fell short of gully
Flintoff to Ponting, no run and Ponting isn't made to play, left alone outside off, and that's stumps on the first day
Onions to Watson, OUT got him first ball! Cut back sharply on Watson who was a little late on this good, quick and straight delivery and that's out!
Onions to Hussey, OUT he's bowled him! He's bowled him! Hussey has left a straight one and his off stump is pegged back! What a disastrous start for Australia
Onions to Clarke, no run that wasn't far away at all! A quick bouncer, misdirected down the leg side, and Clarke wasn't far away from gloving that
Onions to Clarke, no run ooh, a ripper! That's a brute, cutting back and bouncing - significant bounce for Onions in this over. And it's moving around off the seam
Onions to Clarke, no run nicely played out on the front foot to point, but that's a very good line and length
Onions to Clarke, 1 run and that's flicked to leg but he was late on it
Flintoff to Clarke, no run a touch too wide of the off stump and left alone
Flintoff to Clarke, no run good length but again wide enough for Clarke to leave alone
Flintoff to Clarke, no run a stray down the leg side
Flintoff to Clarke, no run left alone outside off. No movement for Flintoff who, at the moment at least, looks a bit stiff
Flintoff to Clarke, no run comfortably left alone

Flintoff to Clarke, FOUR runs inside edge down the leg side. Clarke, understandably nervous about getting forward to Flintoff, especially nervous given the two shock wickets that have brought him to the crease, flicked it very late and past
Onions to Ponting, 1 run excellent line on middle stump and Ponting walks across his stumps and flicks to mid-on. Onions throws his hands up in the air in anguish, but that's such a Ponting shot
Onions to Clarke, 1 run another very good line on off stump, just straightening a touch, but well played by Clarke and well run, a single to cover
Onions to Ponting, FOUR runs outside edge for four! Ponting came lunging forward, as he has done all his career, though he did open the face
Onions to Ponting, no run very straight, Ponting tries to work it to leg but is rapped high on the thigh, or possibly the midriff
Onions to Ponting, 1 run solid, confident, aggressive drive to Broad at mid-off
Onions to Clarke, no run wide and left alone outside off

Flintoff to Ponting, 3 runs Ponting flicks past short-leg and only by a whisker. An absolute whisker! But Ponting becomes Australia's leading run-scorer in Test matches and he acknowledges the warm applause from a grateful and knowledgeable
Flintoff to Clarke, no run bouncer. He ducks. The crowd roar.

Flintoff to Clarke, FOUR runs he reached for that, Clarke, but his off-side play this summer has been quite majestic. Four to him, and though he played it a long way from his body, such was the timing that it shot to the extra-cover boundary
Flintoff to Clarke, no run short delivery, Clarke hops back and defends
Flintoff to Clarke, no run fuller delivery that's left alone
Flintoff to Clarke, 2 runs elegant flick off his pads
Onions to Ponting, 2 runs hurries Ponting onto a pull who plays it with one hand off the bat. A mis-pull, if you like, and fortunately it lands safely at midwicket
Onions to Ponting, no run ideal line and length. Ponting's forward, offering an ideal defensive too
Onions to Ponting, no run nice and full and stroked out to cover
Onions to Ponting, 3 runs walks across his stumps to work this through midwicket. Ponting lively today, keen to keep the board ticking. And so it is
Onions to Clarke, no run on middle-and-off, Clarke - slightly squared up, both feet pointing down the pitch - defends
Onions to Clarke, no run fast leg-cutter with nice carry to Prior. Shoulders arms
Flintoff to Ponting, no run much too wide. Flintoff's radar is on the blink
Flintoff to Ponting, no run that's better, shaping in on Ponting's off stump and he defends solidly, though it almost took the splice of his bat...as it often does with Flintoff given his height
Flintoff to Ponting, no run on the back foot, this time, Ponting's giving a lesson in orthodoxy of defence. Which, in isolation, is fascinating to watch
Flintoff to Ponting, no run left alone outside off
Flintoff to Ponting, no run very good line and defended to Bell at point. Very solidly defended, too
Flintoff to Ponting, 2 runs cuts back late on Ponting who turns his wrists elegantly, and very late, to steal two to fine leg
Onions to Clarke, no run the yorker. The first of the day. And dealt with comfortably by Clarke
Onions to Clarke, no run another leg-cutter but it's too wide
Onions to Clarke, no run wide and left alone. Leg-cutter. Or leg-cudder, as Richie would say
Onions to Clarke, no run well bowled again, Onions just finding one to straighten on Clarke. Almost a fast legbreak, that, and very nearly squares Clarke up fatally
Onions to Clarke, no run another leg-cutter but wide of the off stump
Onions to Clarke, no run on the off stump and defended
Flintoff to Ponting, FOUR runs Flintoff altered his delivery, sending it down with a double-whirl of the arm, but Ponting's played that beautifully through midwicket for four. Too straight
Flintoff to Ponting, 1 run punched out to cover and Ponting calls for a single, and this'll be out if Bell hits. Well out. Close! But home
Flintoff to Clarke, no run short of a length and blocked out to the off side
Flintoff to Clarke, 2 runs short of a length and punched out to the off side for a single
Flintoff to Clarke, no run no, too wide
Flintoff to Clarke, (no ball) ooh that is desperately close to both bowling him and trapping him leg-before but it's a no-ball. Off-cutter...and the no-ball saves Clarke there
Flintoff to Clarke, no run flashed to point
Onions to Ponting, no run straight delivery and good pace, too. Ponting turns it to leg on the back foot
Onions to Ponting, no run bouncer down the leg side
Onions to Ponting, OUT got him! He's out! A quick bouncer, Ponting went for a hook and got a thin edge through to Prior. Onions has bowled so, so well this morning
Onions to North, 1 bye cuts back on North a touch - significant movement after it passed North, and that beats Prior too
Onions to Clarke, no run ooh very well bowled on the off stump. Clarke defends, well back in his crease
Onions to Clarke, no run fantastic delivery! Clarke's lucky to still be alive there. Outswinger, one of the few deliveries this morning that has swung prodigiously, and that beats Clarke's fishy waft
Anderson to North, no run starts with a loosener wide of North's off stump
Anderson to North, no run short of a length, North pats it off the back foot
Anderson to North, no run on middle-and off and swinging away from him
Anderson to North, no run angled across the left-hander who leaves well alone
Anderson to North, no run this does shape back into North, but down the leg side
Anderson to North, no run ignored outside off
Onions to Clarke, FOUR runs shot! He's so good off his legs, and clips it powerfully and elegantly through midwicket. Superb stroke!
Onions to Clarke, no run swings away from the right-hander
Onions to Clarke, no run short of a length and outside off, Clarke punches it to cover. High front elbow, and as orthodox as you could wish to see

Onions to Clarke, no run cuts back sharply and England let out a noise that could probably be heard in London. London in Canada. Beautiful off-cutter which cut back sharp and that is so, so close! Looked to me like it was taking out middle-a
Onions to Clarke, no run just outside off, Clarke doesn't know whether to leave it or play at it
Onions to Clarke, no run swings back very, very late indeed on the right-hander. This is excellent control, as much as anything, from Onions
Anderson to North, no run well wide - too wide
Anderson to North, no run oh well bowled! That bent back markedly, prodigiously on the left-hander! Huge swing for Anderson
Anderson to North, no run that's wide and doesn't swing and is left alone
Anderson to North, no run wide of the off stump and it holds its line
Anderson to North, no run again this doesn't swing. Wide of the off stump
Anderson to North, no run defended on the back foot
Onions to Clarke, no run straight ball from Onions, Clarke defends with a straight bat
Onions to Clarke, no run leans forward and pushes to cover-point
Onions to Clarke, 1 run angled in to the pads, Clarke clips it through midwicket
Onions to North, no run on the hips, North can't get it away for a single
Onions to North, 1 run he does indeed, works this one off his hips behind square to get off the mark after 15 balls and 23 minutes
Onions to Clarke, no run hmm, some curvy inswing there, but it still ended up outside off and Clarke could leave it
Anderson to North, no run swinging in to North here, right on off stump and he defends
Anderson to North, no run solid in defence again, another good ball on off stump
Anderson to North, no run nice line again, swinging back in but a touch outside off and North leaves
Anderson to North, no run angled wider across North this time, he leaves it
Anderson to North, 1 leg bye swinging down leg this time, North gets pad on it and gets a leg-bye
Anderson to Clarke, no run a hint of outswing, Clarke drives to cover and it's well fielded
Onions to North, no run swinging in to North's middle stump, he drives confidently but straight to mid-on
Onions to North, no run another punchy drive, this time straight to cover
Onions to North, no run oops, well bowled but not well played, swinging back in and North seems to leave it to crash into his thigh, half thinking about playing a shot at the same time
Onions to North, no run driven back down the pitch

Onions to North, no run outside off and prodded back down the pitch - or should that be the wicket, as Steve Rouse described the 'pitch' as jelly-like the other day, and says he was referring to the outfield as opposed to the playing strip
Onions to North, 3 runs swivels a pull nicely through midwicket here to pick up three runs
Anderson to North, 1 run swinging in again, North clips it comfortably through the leg side
Anderson to Clarke, 1 run on line this time, Clarke flicks it through square leg wristily
Anderson to North, no run angled bat here from North, who defends to off
Anderson to North, FOUR runs lovely cover drive, angled across North and it didn't swing, so the batsman punched it superbly between cover and mid-off
Anderson to North, no run better ball, pulls the length back a touch and gets it to straighten on line, North defends
Anderson to North, no run no shot offered to ball that drifts away from the left-hander
Onions to Clarke, no run strays down leg side, Clarke can't get bat on it
Onions to Clarke, no run good length, seams back in to Clarke, who defends

Onions to Clarke, no run dropped! Oh dear, that's bad cricket from batsman and fielder. A good outswinger from Onions, Clarke shapes to leave but is too slow and the ball runs off the face of the bat straight to second slip, where Flintoff g
Onions to Clarke, no run down leg side now, Clarke doesn't get anything on it
Onions to Clarke, 3 runs nice pull there from Clarke, he just turned this one from off stump through midwicket and it was well reeled in by Bell on the boundary
Onions to North, 1 leg bye swinging down leg, North gets a thick bit of pad on that and it runs fine
Anderson to North, no run left alone outside off
Anderson to North, no run nice bit of outswing to the left-hander there, left alone
Anderson to North, no run Anderson pushes this one far too wide across North, who isn't even slightly interested in playing at that
Anderson to North, no run straighter, but still outside off, and North lets it go
Anderson to North, no run pushed across again and North leaves
Anderson to North, no run a similar line and again North doesn't have to play
Broad to Clarke, 2 runs starts with a fullish outswinger that Clarke drives square for a couple
Broad to Clarke, FOUR runs really good cover drive this, it's an outswinger right on that drivable length and Clark punches between cover and mid-off
Broad to Clarke, no run straight-bat defence this time
Broad to Clarke, 1 leg bye clipped off his pads this time, and in fact it's a leg-bye
Broad to North, no run better line, on off stump, North defends
Broad to North, 1 run on the pads and North clips to deep square leg
Anderson to North, no run outside off, North defends
Anderson to North, 1 run good running, North drops it into the off side and they take off quickly, both men are safely home
Anderson to Clarke, no run swinging down leg here, Clarke can't work it off his hips
Anderson to Clarke, OUT oh he's got him! A huge inswinger here, curves late and strikes Clarke on middle and leg, Rudi Koertzen lifts the finger
Anderson to Manou, no run left alone outside off for his first ball
Anderson to Manou, FOUR runs and Manou gets off the mark in Tests with a leg-glance off his hips for four
Broad to North, no run defended safely back down the pitch
Broad to North, no run left alone outside off
Broad to North, 1 run clipped away to leg for a single

Broad to Manou, FOUR runs no lack of confidence here from Manou, he gets a short one from Broad and pulls it hard forward of square leg for a boundary, and on its way it clips the fingers of Bell at short leg. Wow, I guess that's technically
Broad to Manou, no run wide-ish outswinger, Manou leaves it
Broad to Manou, no run guided to point
Anderson to North, no run not much swing there, North leaves outside off
Anderson to North, no run punched to cover and there's no run
Anderson to North, no run nudged away to point
Anderson to North, OUT wonderful catch! Prior makes a super take diving to his left across first slip. Fullish ball swinging away from North, who got a thick edge to one that he might have left alone
Anderson to Johnson, OUT oh he's gone too! Swings back in to Johnson, who is in two minds whether to leave it - he does leave it - and it hits him above the knee-roll
Anderson to Hauritz, no run and he survives, Anderson swings it in but just too leg-side and it bounces off Hauritz's thigh
Broad to Manou, 1 leg bye an lbw appeal this time but that one is swinging down leg
Broad to Hauritz, no run outswinger, left alone outside off
Broad to Hauritz, no run no shot offered once again
Broad to Hauritz, no run and again no shot to an outswinger
Broad to Hauritz, no run leaves another one outside off
Broad to Hauritz, no run pushed to cover this time and there's no run
Anderson to Manou, no run pushed to point and can't beat the field
Anderson to Manou, no run no shot to an outswinger
Anderson to Manou, no run defended away to cover this time
Anderson to Manou, no run and there's the big curving inswinger, the same thing that did for Clarke, but this one is heading down leg, which is lucky for Manou as he didn't get bat on it
Anderson to Manou, OUT wow! What a delivery! Anderson comes a touch wider and gets the ball to straighten and it comprehensively smashes Manou's off stump, that is almost the perfect ball.
Anderson to Siddle, no run ooh good leave! Sharp inducker which is left alone
Broad to Hauritz, 2 runs punched out to the off side
Broad to Hauritz, no run down the leg side
Broad to Hauritz, no run just outside off and left alone
Broad to Hauritz, no run well, a touch too wide really from Broad. Left alone
Broad to Hauritz, 2 leg byes flicked off his legs
Broad to Hauritz, no run wow - that sprung from nowhere! Tennis-ball bounce off a length
Anderson to Siddle, no run Siddle is on the back foot and defending on the tips of his toes
Anderson to Siddle, 1 run angling in to Siddle before it swings away late, and he's nearly squared up but squeezes it out to the off side. A run is stolen
Anderson to Hauritz, no run late swing again troubles him, but he plays it back to the bowler
Anderson to Hauritz, no run bouncer, and a tame one, sailing way over his head
Anderson to Hauritz, no run a massive, thick inside edge which threatens to castle him, but his boot saves him. Better line from Jimmy A
Anderson to Hauritz, no run big, booming, wonderful inswinger!
Broad to Siddle, no run good ball, just nibbling away and beating him on the outside edge. Better from Broad. He must keep pitching it up
Broad to Siddle, no run wide of the crease and angling into the right-hander who defends
Broad to Siddle, no run wide of the crease again, and he delivers a wider delivery that Siddle thinks about playing but chooses not to
Broad to Siddle, no run beautiful delivery! Lovely outswinger which drew him into a drive and he missed it completely. That's the length when it's swinging
Broad to Siddle, 1 run on middle stump and nudged to leg - Bell gets onto it and this'll be out if he hits! But, no, for the second time today Big Game Belly (? A Miller) misses
Broad to Hauritz, no run defended on the back foot
Anderson to Siddle, 1 run ooh that was close. Siddle walked across his stumps to this inswinger, a dangerous tactic, but played it well enough in the end
Anderson to Hauritz, 1 run booming inswinger but too straight. Flicked nicely behind square
Anderson to Siddle, 1 run dropped out to cover, this'll be close if the fielder hits - and he doesn't! Bopara did well, if you can say that considering he missed. Well backed-up by Broad
Anderson to Hauritz, no run an elegant and surprisingly powerful drive to mid-off
Anderson to Hauritz, no run worked to mid-on where Bell lurks, stops, fields, and does well
Anderson to Hauritz, no run big shout to a booming, zooming, looming inswinger but it's going down leg
Broad to Siddle, no run slightly wider of the crease, angling into the right-hander
Broad to Siddle, no run nice shape away from the batsman from Broad. Good outswinger
Broad to Siddle, no run and he's beaten him once more with a fine outswinger! This is much better from Broad, much better length
Broad to Siddle, FOUR runs but it's too straight here and shovelled through midwicket for four by Siddle - that's a top shot, not looking to hit it too hard and timing it superbly
Broad to Siddle, FOUR runs edged past gully for four! Played with softish hands, but nevertheless was not in control of that poke on the front foot. Collingwood didn't have a hope of stopping it
Broad to Siddle, no run defended on the back foot
Anderson to Hauritz, FOUR runs a filthy half-tracker from Anderson and slapped, tonked, boshed, flapped over extra cover for four! Take that, son. Bosh
Anderson to Hauritz, 1 run too straight and it swings in late on Hauritz who flicks it through midwicket
Anderson to Siddle, no run superb delivery - excellent cricket all round. A phat, inswinging yorker innit and he dug it out excellently
Anderson to Siddle, no run another inswinger but not quite yorker-length
Anderson to Siddle, no run again this bends back into Siddle who pushes it out quite competently out to the off side
Anderson to Siddle, no run edged but short of the third slip
Broad to Hauritz, 3 runs that's runs, that is. Lovely extra-cover drive, if not quite timing it well enough for four. Onions gives chase and does well
Broad to Siddle, 1 run pushes forward to defend, the ball ending up at gully
Broad to Hauritz, no run defended on the back foot
Broad to Hauritz, no run an outswinging half-volley crunched to mid-off. Hauritz is more than useful with the bat. Solid defensive technique and looks quite orthodox when driving
Broad to Hauritz, no run short of a length and defended out to the off side
Broad to Hauritz, no run wide of the mark. Broad's probably had enough I think. Or rather, Strauss has had enough of him
Anderson to Siddle, no run defended on the back foot
Anderson to Siddle, no run crunched to mid-off
Anderson to Siddle, no run defended on the front foot out to point
Anderson to Siddle, OUT fantastic delivery, swinging in, then straightening a touch on the right-hander who tries to work it through midwicket but gets a thick outside edge for Anderson's five
Anderson to Hilfenhaus, no run ignored outside off
Onions to Hauritz, no run short of a length and fends it to leg, awkwardly
Onions to Hauritz, no run just outside off and punched out to cover
Onions to Hauritz, no run swings wildly down the leg side
Onions to Hauritz, 1 wide oh dear. Miles wide of the off stump - Onions saw Hauritz move
Onions to Hauritz, 1 run clipped to leg
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run oh beaten by a total, rip-snorting jaffa that angled in and swung away. You just cannot play that
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run safely negotiated on the back foot
Anderson to Hauritz, 1 run good, straight delivery that's defended on the back foot
Anderson to Hilfenhaus, FOUR runs full and fast and dug out, with a thick outside edge flying past gully
Anderson to Hilfenhaus, no run
Anderson to Hilfenhaus, no run dug out again - good, straight, inswinging toe-crusher
Anderson to Hilfenhaus, FOUR runs well he's timed that! A squirt outside off which flies through point for four more!
Anderson to Hilfenhaus, no run shorter ball wide of the off stump
Onions to Hauritz, no run beaten outside off - good leg-cutter
Onions to Hauritz, 1 run slapped uppishly past point. Good tailend flapping, this

Onions to Hilfenhaus, 1 run short of a length, he mis-hooks it out to extra cover and Bopara's giving chase and ought to take it comfortably. But drops it! What a clanger. Bopara's having a rubbish series, to be honest
Onions to Hauritz, no run smashed out to the off side
Onions to Hauritz, 4 byes woops! Rotten stray down the leg side and it swings away from poor old Prior
Onions to Hauritz, no run another leg-side loosener
Anderson to Hilfenhaus, no run wide of the off stump. Too wide
Anderson to Hilfenhaus, no run left alone by Hilfenhaus, comfortably so
Anderson to Hilfenhaus, no run booming inswinger, but well defended by Hilfenhaus
Anderson to Hilfenhaus, FOUR runs bosh - take that! Good, tailend humpty-dumpty hitting. Cracked over extra cover. You can't beat tailenders swinging the bat - much entertainment
Anderson to Hilfenhaus, no run sharp bouncer, Hilfenhaus temporarily thinks he's Viv Richards and attempts to hit him into the street but misses. Good intent, though. Just give it a whack
Anderson to Hilfenhaus, 2 runs Hilfenhaus was several minutes too late on this one, but still got it away to leg. What a legend
Onions to Hauritz, no run left alone
Onions to Hauritz, 1 run in the slot, driven hard to the off side
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run driven to gully
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run wide of the off stump and left alone
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run well defended, getting right back in line
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run better length, swinging away and beating the house of Hilfen
Flintoff to Hauritz, no run touch wide and left alone
Flintoff to Hauritz, 1 run worked to leg
Flintoff to Hilfenhaus, no run much too wide. Flintoff's travails today continue. He looks about as enthused as an asthmatic tortoise
Flintoff to Hilfenhaus, no run good line and it's defended to gully
Flintoff to Hilfenhaus, no run a wide, un-Flintoffish leg-cutter
Flintoff to Hilfenhaus, no run short, wide, left alone
Onions to Hauritz, no run defended on the back foot
Onions to Hauritz, no run big, late, massive swing wide of the off stump
Onions to Hauritz, 2 runs well, that's too straight really, and flicked off his pads
Onions to Hauritz, 1 run short of a length and defended on the back foot
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run beaten by a lifter outside off
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run beaten once again outside off, superb delivery
Flintoff to Hauritz, no run a bouncer and it's ducked beneath by Haley Osment
Flintoff to Hauritz, no run another bouncer and he ducks once more
Flintoff to Hauritz, 1 run nicely driven, that, out through extra cover
Flintoff to Hilfenhaus, no run wide and he ducks away from it slightly oddly, and realises how daft he looks, nearly wafting the bat while on his knees
Flintoff to Hilfenhaus, 1 run angled down to third man
Flintoff to Hauritz, no run
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run goes back to defend on the back foot
Onions to Hilfenhaus, FOUR runs top shot, that! Short, wide and clattered over backward point with a, well, a clatter
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run oh well bowled, good comeback. Beats him with a fine outswinger
Onions to Hilfenhaus, OUT got him! Another slapping drive finds Swann in the gully, and that's the final wicket for Onions who finishes with four wickets

So Australia end on 263. Certainly an underpar total, but England's openers will need to be alert: Hilfenhaus and Co. swing it too. Anderson leads off his troops after finishing with five wickets. Righto, so join Brydon in about ten minutes for the

5.45pm The umpires have offered the light to England, and the batsmen have decided to go off. Strauss raises the bat as he walks off, he has played a really solid innings, giving England a strong platform at 116 for 2. It's not officially stumps, b
5.55pm The covers are coming on now, there are a few spots of rain. And the forecast is for rain tonight and tomorrow morning, clearing tomorrow afternoon.
6.10pm The umpires, who were hanging around on the pitch, have now left for the dressing room which doesn't suggest we will see a resumption.

6.25pm - stumps So, that's it for the second day's play - an enthralling day it was. Don't forget to check out the video highlights (plenty to watch tonight) along with the bulletin if you've missed any of the play. And most importantly of all, mos

10.25am Morning all. Will here for the third day and the first news is that the covers are on, under heavy leaden skies, and we're almost certainly in for a delay. Average, I know, but we'll keep you amused nevertheless. It doesn't look terminal. I

"Maybe I'll get down there and torment the Shemanator," taunts Shane Warne after hearing England are playing a lot of poker at the moment. He just can't leave it, can he? And that's why we love him. Poor old Bell. Talking of poker, have a read of A

10.45am The umpires are out in the middle and having a look. It's dark and not ideal conditions, though it's not actually raining. More of a drizzle, and it doesn't really know whether to stop or whether to give it absolutely everything. Frustratin
11.00am No chance of any play before lunch, we reckon. It's seriously moist and damp out there. There'll be another pitch inspection at midday, and we'll keep you up to speed then.

12.00pm Right, pitch inspection is currently underway, but the two umpires don't look too enthusiastic and it's drizzling persistently. Meanwhile, doesn't Aleem Dar have a stupendous mullet atop his nugget? It looks like it's made out of wax. Outst

"It's almost as soft as the first day," says Rudi of the bowlers' run-ups. Another inspection at 1.30pm. Miserable weather, no wind, no sun to help dry it out, and we're some way short of watching any cricket. Intense and massive fail.
A history of the mullet in cricket
2.00pm News! Inspection at 2.30pm. Bye.
Perusing what cricket books are coming up for sale. Always interesting to see who's publishing what. Don't forget out reviews section in the Magazine.
An area of soft, wet, low-lying land, characterized by grassy vegetation and often forming a transition zone between water and land.
2.35pm Right. It's a bog. A marsh. Here's the dictionary definition of marsh:

2.40pm And play has been abandoned for the day, and what a miserable scene this is for the poor old groundsmen. It's dark, gloomy, cold and chucking it down. And it's the end of our comms, too. So do join us tomorrow morning at 10.30am, when hopefu
Hauritz to Strauss, no run prodded away defensively
Hauritz to Strauss, no run tosses this one up big time, spins away, and Strauss leaves it
Hauritz to Strauss, no run flatter and quicker, on line, Strauss defends
Hauritz to Strauss, 1 run on the pads this time, Strauss clips away easily through leg
Hauritz to Bell, no run some turn in to Bell, but outside off and he leaves it
Hauritz to Bell, no run once again Bell opts not to play at an offbreak
Johnson to Strauss, no run prodded away to cover
Johnson to Strauss, no run straight-bat defence from Strauss
Johnson to Strauss, no run ouch, Strauss cops on on the thigh there
Johnson to Strauss, no run pushed away to the off side
Johnson to Strauss, 1 run short ball this time, Strauss pulls to fine leg
Johnson to Bell, 2 runs clipped of his hips down to fine leg and they get back for a couple
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run good start, swinging it back into Strauss who digs it out
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run poor leg-side stray, swinging away from Manou who makes an excellent dive to his right to save four byes
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run late swing, driven firmly back to Hilfenhaus
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run more movement from outside the off stump, and Strauss comes calmly forward
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run wide of the off stump
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run again well bowled, swinging it in late and it's dug out
Siddle to Bell, no run wide of the off stump and left alone
Siddle to Bell, no run very wide of the off stump and left alone once more by Bell
Siddle to Bell, no run again too wide, not making Bell play. Safely ignored
Siddle to Bell, no run defended on the back foot
Siddle to Bell, no run Bell steps forward...and watches this sail past him wide of the off stump
Siddle to Bell, no run better ball, defended on the front foot to gully, but Bell was only made to play twice in that over
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run outside edge - drops short of first slip! Strauss only came patting forward, very soft hands. Nicely bowled by Hilfenhaus
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run cracked behind square but straight to point
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run booming inswinger and nice and full. Strauss drives firmly to Johnson at mid-off
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run another inswinger greets Strauss who responds with an identical, and orthodox, off-drive back to the bowler. Though he did get an inside edge
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run slanted across Strauss
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run outside off, swinging back in and it's defened
Siddle to Bell, FOUR runs beautiful shot for four. A defensive push off the back foot behind square, and in spite of all the rain that has chucked itself all over Birmingham, the outfield's quick
Siddle to Bell, no run good line just outside off. Bell's right behind it
Siddle to Bell, no run well wide of the off stump, cutting wider still. Bell ignores
Siddle to Bell, no run that's hit him. Siddle's produced a good off-cutter which beats Bell and raps him in the midriff. Very good ball. Bell nods in appreciation

Siddle to Bell, no run the first one which swung really late on Bell, who is rapped on the pads, but it's turned down by Rudi. That looks really, really tight, and replays suggest that was probably taking out middle stump about halfway up...
Siddle to Bell, no run left alone outside off
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run bends back sharply on Strauss who is calm in defence
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run left alone outside off this time
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, 1 run on leg stump and it swings very late onto his legs, and it's clipped neatly - very late - behind square
Hilfenhaus to Bell, no run outswinger to Bell who leaves alone
Hilfenhaus to Bell, 1 run another outswinger but a touch fuller and straighter, allowing Bell onto the front foot. After a bit of hesitation, they take a single

Hilfenhaus to Strauss, FOUR runs short of a length and pulled magnificently for four. He didn't really climb into it, but he's in such good form at the moment that it absolutely sped between midwicket and mid-on for four. Super shot
Siddle to Bell, no run ever so slightly wider of the crease, and a very good line to Bell just outside off, swinging away a touch
Siddle to Bell, no run just outside off. Good, testing line this by Siddle. Bell's up to the challenge so far, defending solidly on the back foot

Siddle to Bell, FOUR runs ooh beautiful shot. An outswinger on off stump and he waited and waited, flicking it through midwicket for four with perfect timing. Dangerous shot, that, but he nailed it on this occasion

Siddle to Bell, no run sharp, shorter delivery flies down the leg side and possibly off his hip or his backside - absolutely brilliant take by Manou flying to his left! Outstanding snaffle, that really was. Nowhere near the bat, in spite of
Siddle to Bell, 5 wide oh dear, that's a shame for Siddle. A loose leg-side stray - just didn't come out right and flew miles wide of both batsman and keeper
Siddle to Bell, no run an inswinger, defended solidly - very solidly indeed, head right over the ball
Siddle to Bell, no run thought he hit that! Terrific ball holding its line, beating Bell's waft
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run defended on the back foot
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run nice line again from the steady, reliable Hilfenhaus, bending it back on the left-hander who defends
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run another excellent inswinger to Strauss, but he's again solid in defence
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run an identical delivery. Fascinating duel between this pair
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run cover-driven marvellously, but a super stop by the diving cover. Johnson, I think
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run crashed into the covers once more
Siddle to Bell, no run much too wide

Siddle to Bell, FOUR runs oh, fabulous shot from Bell. No great follow-through - his main intention was firstly to get forward securely, head over the ball, then he just punched it through cover. As it happened, it went for four, but it was
Siddle to Bell, no run a waste from Siddle. Too wide
Siddle to Bell, no run Bell leaves this outside off
Siddle to Bell, no run fantastic cover drive! Wow - shot of the morning, but an equally excellent stop by Ponting at short-extra. Sheesh
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, OUT Gone! Hilfenhaus makes the breakthrough, Strauss goes at last. Short of a length outside off and he gets a thick top edge attempting to cut, straightforward take for Manou.
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, no run fullish ball, drives back to the bowler
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, no run full outswinger, Collingwood drives and gets a thickish edge away to point
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, 1 run Collingwood gets off the mark with a clip behind square leg
Hilfenhaus to Bell, no run worked to midwicket
Hilfenhaus to Bell, no run fullish again, tempting Bell to drive, he just defends this one
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run oops, full and wide outside off, no need to play at that
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run left alone outside off
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run pushed away to cover this time
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run angled in to the pads, worked to midwicket
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run no shot outside off, no real swing there for Siddle
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run beats the outside edge this time, it was wide of off and moving further away, Collingwood had a flash
Hilfenhaus to Bell, no run right on line, no swing though and it's driven to mid-on
Hilfenhaus to Bell, no run curving away from Bell, who defends on the back foot
Hilfenhaus to Bell, no run left alone outside off
Hilfenhaus to Bell, 1 run short this time, Bell pulls to deep midwicket for a single
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, no run good outswinger, nice line and Collingwood prods defensively to cover
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, no run same line again, Collingwood pushes it to cover once more
Johnson to Bell, no run oh, on the money immediately, an inswinger that does Bell for pace and takes the left pad, big lbw shout but there was a thin inside edge on that
Johnson to Bell, no run good ball again, bending back in to Bell, who defends this one
Johnson to Bell, no run 89mph or 144kph, Johnson is nice and quick early, bouncing it across Bell, who leaves
Johnson to Bell, no run cracking bouncer now, dead on line and Bell gets it down to the leg side but didn't look comfortable
Johnson to Bell, FOUR runs good shot, nice cover-drive to a half-volley angled across Bell, finds the gap and releases some of the pressure from the first few balls of that over
Johnson to Bell, no run defended back down to mid-off
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs nice drive through cover from Collingwood, it was an outswinging half-volley and he's timed that one pretty well
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, no run good bounce now from Hilfenhaus, Collingwood nudges it down to leg
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs outswinger again, comes off a thick edge straight into the ground and wide of the cordon and runs away to third man
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, no run leaves this outswinger alone
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, no run Hilfenhaus continues to curve it away, Collingwood defends with soft hands
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs well done Paul Collingwood, outswinger again but he places this well between point and gully and angles it down so it's perfectly safe
Johnson to Bell, no run bangs it in short now, Bell defends it to gully
Johnson to Bell, no run short of a length outside off, Bell defends
Johnson to Bell, no run short again, he's not giving the ball a chance to swing this over, Bell defends
Johnson to Bell, no run angled across Bell this time and fuller, he leaves it

Johnson to Bell, no run ooh, that's dropped, but only in a technical sense. Bell clips it hard into the shoulder of Katich at short leg, it bounces down towards his hands and clips the fingers on the way to the ground. No real chance to catc
Johnson to Bell, no run defended safely back down the pitch
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, no run left alone outside off
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, no run outswinger again, Collingwood defends
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, no run down leg side, can't get bat on it
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, no run punched to cover off the back foot
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, OUT Hilfenhaus gets another! Well bowled, a fullish outswinger and Collingwood drives, the thick edge is well taken by Ponting above his head at second slip
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run an outswinger on the off stump, firmly defended
Johnson to Bell, no run starts well with a sharp bouncer which flies through Bell's attempted hook
Johnson to Bell, no run outside off and just bending back a touch. Johnson glares

Johnson to Bell, FOUR runs on his legs and nicely tucked around the corner for four to bring up his 20th Test fifty on his return to the England side. He's had some luck to say the last, but has played well nevertheless. 50 from 96
Johnson to Bell, 1 run prodded out to the off side for a single
Johnson to Prior, no run on the off stump and shaping back into the right-hander, Prior defends to point
Johnson to Prior, no run more swing back into Prior who defends nicely off the back foot, angling it out to the off side
Hilfenhaus to Bell, (no ball) gentle shape into Bell who defends
Hilfenhaus to Bell, no run swings wide of Bell who ignores it. Wisely so
Hilfenhaus to Bell, no run sharp outswing this time, but a little too short to lure Bell who shoulders arms
Hilfenhaus to Bell, no run on the off stump and he prods forward to defend
Hilfenhaus to Bell, no run excellent delivery on off stump, shaping away very nicely but Bell's defending it solidly on the front foot
Hilfenhaus to Bell, no run a full toss bashed back to the bowler
Hilfenhaus to Bell, no run outside off and defended
Johnson to Prior, no run Prior comes forward cautiously, defending it on the front foot
Johnson to Prior, 1 run on the middle stump, Prior tucks it to leg to get off the mark
Johnson to Bell, no run ah - slower ball, good thinking, but poor execution. Miles too wide of Bell
Johnson to Bell, no run bouncer down the leg side
Johnson to Bell, no run Bell goes back to defend on the back foot with a straight bat
Johnson to Bell, no run good line on the off stump at 90.5mph and Bell's back and across and defending
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run good, full delivery with the merest hint of swing away from the batsman, but he climbs into a solid and defensive drive to mid-on
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run more good lines from Hilfenhaus, this time an inch or two outside off. Solid in defence once more
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run beaten by a beauty! But that's a crud shot from Prior. Swinging away, too short to drive, and he flashes and misses outside off
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run driven hard and caught! No! Just short of the diving gully. Another loose stroke by Prior
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run lovely outswinger wide of Prior
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run and another very good line and length is greeted with a defensive prod by Prior to end a fine over. Really good stuff from Hilfenhaus
Johnson to Bell, no run touch too short and wide, really
Johnson to Bell, no run just outside off at 90.3mph. Bell's right behind it
Johnson to Bell, no run the inswinger but it started on leg stump. Good signs for Johnson, though. At least he's moving it for once
Johnson to Bell, no run 91.4mph outside off, Bell chops down but gully pulls off a superb stop diving to his right. Fine piece of work
Johnson to Bell, 2 runs short, Bell pulls it hard into the ground but without really timing it. Hauritz gives chase and restricts them to two
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run wide of the off stump, swinging wider still
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run way too short. Prior leaves it alone comfortably
Hilfenhaus to Prior, FOUR runs ah, top shot. Prior is dangerous through the off side and scores at a serious lick. Thumping cover-drive, on the up
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run more banana curve away from Prior who leaves alone
Hilfenhaus to Prior, 3 runs chops down on this and opens the face past point. A squeezy sort of stroke, and an effective one too
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, no run chops down late on that! Excellent, full outswinger
Johnson to Prior, (no ball) Johnson's booming it now! Monstrous inswing, and late too. He's really got it going now
Johnson to Prior, no run this one holds its line - shorter, too - and Prior fends it short of gully. Hussey pulls off a fine stop to his left
Johnson to Prior, 1 run on the off stump, Prior comes forward and drops it out for a single
Johnson to Flintoff, no run ah, top bowling! Flintoff expects it to swing back, but it holds its line and beats his wafty poke

Johnson to Flintoff, no run beaten by a brute that lifts off a length! This is the sort of bowling we were promised before the series, but which has evaded him utterly until now. Right now. He's got it swinging and he's getting them to fly t
Johnson to Flintoff, no run on the back foot, defended by Flintoff
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run outswinger and defended solidly
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run nice away swinger once more
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run short of a length this time. Prior defends very solidly on the back foot, bat nice and straight
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run straight, full and defended. Hilfenhaus has been so accurate. Have a look at his pitch map from our frankly brilliant live hawk-eye feed
Hilfenhaus to Prior, 2 runs comes forward cautiously and drives nicely out to deep extra cover, not looking to hit the leather off it, just patting it calmly
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run comes forward to defend
Johnson to Flintoff, 1 run swings in a touch on the off stump, but Flintoff prods it out to the off side. Johnson's giving him a flurry of verbals and he responds in kind
Johnson to Prior, 2 byes the first real stray from Johnson, and the crowd love it. Wings it wide of the leg stump. Manou doesn't have a hope. What a winner
Johnson to Prior, FOUR runs marvellous stroke really, but a poor ball. Too full and too straight, Prior flicks it through the leg-side with power and timing, not unlike Atherton might have done it
Johnson to Prior, no run calmly defended to point this time
Johnson to Prior, no run short of a length and defended out to the off side
Johnson to Prior, (no ball) edged but just short of the keeper! And it's a no-ball. Double ouch
Johnson to Prior, no run that's a twit of a shot. A flash outside off
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, no run well defended by Flintoff, coming forward on the front foot
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, FOUR runs that. Is. Runs. That's runs, that is. Thumping cover-drive for four
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, (no ball) 1 run driven out to the off side
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run comes forward to defend
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run fuller delivery, but Prior's solid in defence
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run nice shape away from Prior but he pats it calmly out to the off side
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run played out to backward point
Johnson to Flintoff, no run a tame bouncer. Flintoff ducks, and has a giggle as Johnson gives him a glare
Johnson to Flintoff, no run solid defensive on the back foot
Johnson to Flintoff, no run ooh well bowled. Johnson and his blindingly white teeth (what's that all about?) fires in a fine inswinger which Flintoff only just digs out
Johnson to Flintoff, no run an ugly slap from Flintoff back past the bowler. No timing whatsoever
Johnson to Flintoff, (no ball) leaves this alone outside off, but it's another no-ball
Johnson to Flintoff, no run punched off the back foot
Johnson to Flintoff, 1 run on the middle stump, flicked through midwicket
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, no run late away swing from Flintoff who, very wisely, leaves alone
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, 2 runs tucked around the corner for a quick couple
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, no run on the front foot, slapping out to cover
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, no run more shape away from the right hander, but Flintoff's firmly behind it with a solid, oak-dooresque defensive
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, no run swinging wide of the off stump
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, no run full on the off stump
Siddle to Prior, no run a lifter! And he plays and misses
Siddle to Prior, no run cuts back on the right-hander
Siddle to Prior, no run what a ball! What a delivery that is, moving back and cutting Prior in half. Brute of a ball
Siddle to Prior, 1 run this one holds its line, and Prior defends it powerfully out to the off side
Siddle to Flintoff, 1 leg bye a leg-bye is taken. Flintoff limps through - could have had two, but he's nowhere near fit enough
Siddle to Prior, 2 runs sweetly driven out to the off side
Watson to Flintoff, no run wide of the off stump and left alone
Watson to Flintoff, no run way too wide. Swings wider still
Watson to Flintoff, no run wide of the off stump and left alone
Watson to Flintoff, no run driven back to the bowler firmly
Watson to Flintoff, FOUR runs bang! The first really authoritative shot from Flintoff, absolutely murdering it down the ground. Nothing more than a prod, but it nearly killed Prior
Watson to Flintoff, no run wide of the off stump
Siddle to Prior, 1 run lovely cover drive but stopped by backward point
Siddle to Flintoff, 1 run that's well run. Prodded to cover and he took off...a little slowly. Not quite limping but...
Siddle to Prior, no run swings in late on Prior who bashes it back to Siddle
Siddle to Prior, 1 run square-driven with a flourish
Siddle to Flintoff, 1 leg bye wide of the crease and angling into his pads
Siddle to Prior, no run very solid on-drive, but mid-on does well
Watson to Flintoff, FOUR runs bash! Nothing more than a defensive push, straight back through Watson's legs and it scorches for four! Flintoff doesn't move
Watson to Flintoff, 1 run a clip off his legs for a single
Watson to Prior, 2 runs short, and pulled - mispulled, the ball skying high but safe into the midwicket region and dropping dead on the soggy outfield
Watson to Prior, 1 run guided out to the off side
Watson to Flintoff, no run well wide and cutting still further wide
Watson to Flintoff, no run much better line on the off stump, with a hint of nibble. Defended on the front foot
Siddle to Prior, 1 run short ball, lofts a hook away over midwicket
Siddle to Flintoff, 2 runs some tailing inswing there, Flintoff clips it nicely off his pads and they run sharply to get two to the man on the boundary
Siddle to Flintoff, FOUR runs power. Cracking power. Flintoff hammers this drive through cover point and there's not much doubt about that one reaching the boundary
Siddle to Flintoff, no run good ball, beats the edge this time with a better length
Siddle to Flintoff, 1 run clipped away off the pads to deep square leg
Siddle to Prior, no run defended to mid-on
Watson to Flintoff, FOUR runs superb off-drive. Magnificent timing and placement, it was a half-volley outside off and Flintoff cracks it wide of mid-off
Watson to Flintoff, 2 runs angled bat down behind gully and the third man sweeps
Watson to Flintoff, 1 run good sensible cricket here, the field was spread a bit and he's bunted it through cover for a couple
Watson to Prior, FOUR runs another excellent drive, but it was also another bad ball, a low full toss that is driven beautifully through cover
Watson to Prior, no run better length this time, left alone outside off
Watson to Prior, no run straight-bat defence this time
Siddle to Flintoff, no run ouch. Bangs in a bouncer and Flintoff ducks but appears to lose sight of it, the ball thuds into his left bicep
Siddle to Flintoff, FOUR runs aggressive bowling again, short and on the body, Flintoff doesn't look comfortable but gets some glove on it and it runs away to fine leg
Siddle to Flintoff, 1 run cramps Flintoff up again, he gets it away to square leg but edgily and he didn't know where it had gone
Siddle to Prior, FOUR runs Prior won't back down from this bouncer though, he's gone for the hook and a top edge flies down to fine leg for a boundary
Siddle to Prior, no run good length now, a bit of shape in to Prior this time and he lets it go

Siddle to Prior, FOUR runs that is a tremendous shot. Prior pounces on one that's just short of a length and drives it wonderfully off the back foot through cover point, that positively sped off the bat
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run good line straight off, Flintoff lunges forward to defend
Hauritz to Flintoff, 3 runs a bit too short and Flintoff punches it through cover, the ball is chased down just inside the boundary
Hauritz to Prior, no run turns it off the pads but can't beat the field
Hauritz to Prior, 1 run just a tiny bit short and Prior pulls it through midwicket
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run tossed up and Flintoff defends
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run outside off, only the tiniest amount of turn, Flintoff shuffles across and then leaves
Siddle to Prior, FOUR runs lovely on-drive, inswinger and angled to the pads, Prior pounces and times that one terrifically
Siddle to Prior, no run doesn't time this one though, it's shorter, Prior tries to pull and gets a thickish under-edge
Siddle to Prior, OUT oops, mistimes this one and that's the end of Prior. Short ball, pulled and comes off the bottom of the bat, lobbing up to mid-on where the 12th man Phil Hughes takes the catch
Siddle to Broad, no run good length, Broad defends back down the pitch
Siddle to Broad, no run squares him up this time, it flies off a thickish edge to gully, along the ground
Siddle to Broad, no run nice delivery, pitches on off and seams across the left-hander, Broad dabs and it beats the edge
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run nice drift in to Flintoff, who prods to leg

Hauritz to Flintoff, SIX runs oooh, Flintoff uses the feet here and lofts Hauritz clean over long-on, lovely shot, after some third-umpire assistance that is ruled a six having hit the boundary on the full
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run defended away safely
Hauritz to Flintoff, FOUR runs another good shot, Flintoff sweeps from outside off and it runs away through square leg for a boundary
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run shuffles across and takes one on the pad, a long way outside off
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run Hauritz squirts this one well wide of off, too wide for Flintoff to be interested
Siddle to Broad, no run tests Broad with a short one, he takes it on the chest
Siddle to Broad, no run Siddle bangs it in shortish again, Broad tries to defend but this one strikes him on the left bicep
Siddle to Broad, no run outside off here, Broad leaves it
Siddle to Broad, 1 leg bye ah, Siddle just gets the line wrong now, down leg and Broad gets some pad on it
Siddle to Flintoff, 1 run swivels a pull around to deep square leg
Siddle to Broad, no run straight ball now, Broad defends
Hauritz to Flintoff, 2 runs shouts of 'catch' as Flintoff drives in the air but it's wide of point and is collected on the boundary
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run well wide of off, almost a wide
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run drifts onto off stump now, Flintoff defends
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run flatter and fuller outside off, he tries to cut but it beats the bat
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run a hint of offspin, wide of off, Flintoff defends
Hauritz to Flintoff, 1 run tossed up and Flintoff drives a single to long-on
Siddle to Flintoff, 2 runs miscues a pull that lobs away to long-on
Siddle to Flintoff, FOUR runs good pull, quick onto that one and it sails over midwicket perfectly safely and runs away to the boundary
Siddle to Flintoff, 1 run opens the face and guides it away through point
Siddle to Broad, 2 runs goes for the yorker here but Broad squeezes it through midwicket and gets off the mark
Siddle to Broad, FOUR runs well played, Siddle pushes this one across and tempts the drive, Broad obliges but it's a very well timed and placed shot through extra cover

Siddle to Broad, 2 runs oh is that a drop? No, it's just fallen short of Manou. Angled across Broad and a thick edge dips on the keeper, lands a few centimetres in front of his left glove and then runs away to third man
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run prodded away defensively
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run works it to midwicket
Hauritz to Flintoff, 1 run too much time for Flintoff here, he cuts it away through point with ease
Hauritz to Broad, 2 runs Hauritz comes around the wicket and Broad dabs a sweep to fine leg
Hauritz to Broad, no run there's some turn, Broad leaves it outside off
Hauritz to Broad, no run a stifled shout as this one drifts in and catches the inside edge onto Broad's pad
Johnson to Flintoff, no run nice line to start with, Flintoff looks to work through leg and then checks his shot
Johnson to Flintoff, FOUR runs outside edge, but it's a thick one and races between gully and slips and there's no third man
Johnson to Flintoff, no run fuller this time, and a bit slower, Flintoff drives to mid-off
Johnson to Flintoff, no run good ball, pitches in line and swings back in, takes Flintoff on the thigh pad
Johnson to Flintoff, no run squirts this one across and it's full, Flintoff tries to squeeze it through off but can't make contact
Johnson to Flintoff, FOUR runs Flintoff smites this one through cover, it was in the air but just out of reach of short extra cover
Hauritz to Broad, no run drifts in from around the wicket, Broad works it to leg
Hauritz to Broad, no run prodded away defensively to leg again
Hauritz to Broad, no run tosses it up outside off, Broad defends
Hauritz to Broad, 1 run pokes a single to mid-on
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run wide of off, Flintoff doesn't offer a shot
Hauritz to Flintoff, 2 runs again it's tossed up outside off, Flintoff cracks it through cover
Johnson to Broad, FOUR runs that is a glorious shot! The straightest possible boundary, it's driven just a smidgen wide of the stumps at the bowler's end and timed so wonderfully
Johnson to Broad, no run inside edge onto pad
Johnson to Broad, no run wide of off, Broad cuts but can't beat backward point
Johnson to Broad, no run bouncer, Broad tries to hook and can't get anything on it
Johnson to Broad, no run bangs it in and Broad defends
Johnson to Broad, no run short outside off, prodded to cover
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run turns in from outside off, Flintoff defends
Hauritz to Flintoff, 1 run cut away through cover for a single
Hauritz to Broad, 3 runs well placed, Broad works against the spin but with the drift, and chips it over wide midwicket
Hauritz to Flintoff, OUT well, well. That's a very odd dismissal, it spins out of the rough and Flintoff plays no shot, but doesn't get his gloves out of the way, and the catch is taken at first slip
Hauritz to Swann, no run defended back down the pitch

Hauritz to Swann, no run ouch, driven hard back down the pitch and Hauritz hurls out the right hand and takes a painful blow, very similar to the knock that dislocated his finger earlier in the series
Johnson to Broad, 1 run flicked away off the pads for a single
Johnson to Swann, no run bangs it in and it's pushed to point
Johnson to Swann, 1 wide short ball, not surprising with the short leg in place, but it's just a bit too far over the head
Johnson to Swann, no run bounces him again, Swann ducks this one
Johnson to Swann, no run good slower one here, beats the outside edge
Johnson to Swann, no run driven to cover and can't beat the field
Johnson to Swann, no run pushed away to cover again
Hauritz to Broad, no run drifts in from around the wicket, defended
Hauritz to Broad, no run nudged away to gully
Hauritz to Broad, no run pushed to mid-on
Hauritz to Broad, 1 run tip and run here, nudged to midwicket and they hare through for a quick single, the throw at the stumps ricochets off the bat and so they don't take any overthrows
Hauritz to Swann, FOUR runs too short, too wide, and that's an appropriately straightforward crunch through cover for a boundary
Hauritz to Swann, no run prodded away defensively again
Johnson to Broad, no run fires it in wide down the leg side
Johnson to Broad, no run another horrid stray down the leg side. I hope Manou didn't have anything too stodgy at tea, because he's being given a bit of a workout right now
Johnson to Broad, 1 run gets this shorter ball on target and Broad fends it down to fine leg. Nasty delivery
Johnson to Swann, FOUR runs short of a length and punched elegantly off the back foot, just like Dominic Cork would've done
Johnson to Swann, no run short of a length and defended on the back foot
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run defended on the back foot, with quite a diagonal bat, out to mid-off
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run nicely driven to mid-off
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run well bowled, angled across him and Broad flashes and missed
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run left alone outside off
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run and again Broad flashes and misses
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run nicely punched to mid-off off the back foot
Johnson to Swann, no run goes back to defend
Johnson to Swann, 1 run chopped down and steals a single to cover
Johnson to Broad, no run another swing and a miss from Broad! He's completely taken his eye off the ball since tea
Johnson to Broad, no run and again. He swings. He misses.
Johnson to Broad, no run good line just outside off, and he defends on the back foot
Johnson to Broad, FOUR runs heck of a shot. He had to wait for it, slightly slower, but Broad timed it amazingly well through the leg side. Aerial, but perfectly safe

Hilfenhaus to Swann, FOUR runs sliced off the back foot past gully and no third man - that'll be four. Hauritz gives chase from deep point, slides, and takes out a massive chunk of turf which he begrudgingly has to replace. The crowd give hi
Hilfenhaus to Swann, 1 run nice and full but a lovely clip off his toes
Hilfenhaus to Broad, FOUR runs flashes and get an edge past the slips for four more! No third man. Oh deary me. Australia are haemorrhaging runs here
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run left alone outside off
Hilfenhaus to Broad, 2 runs a tuck off his hips in front of square. Hauritz receives a cheer for successfully stopping it this time. Good old drunken banter from a boozed-up Edgbaston
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run beaten with a beauty that lifted and left Broad's swishing blade. Hilfenhaus is seriously unimpressed and gives Bambi a sweaty glare
Johnson to Swann, FOUR runs four more! This is ridiculous. Swann throws the bat and it flies down to the vacant third man
Johnson to Swann, (no ball) wayhay! A no-ball bouncer, Swann sways out of the way
Johnson to Swann, FOUR runs four! Short and chopped brilliantly behind point. That's quite a shot from a tailender. Great balance
Johnson to Anderson, 1 run off the mark first ball! Nudged off his hip
Johnson to Broad, FOUR runs what a shot. What a stroke from Broad. Johnson's giving him an absolute earful, but this is a serious stroke - off the back-foot, straight down the ground.
Johnson to Broad, 1 run a neat flick off his hip
Hilfenhaus to Broad, 1 run a squidge through midwicket
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run left alone outside off
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run nice line outside off, Anderson leaves it alone
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run fuller and he drives and misses
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run attempted yorker but it's a full toss, bashed back to the bowler
Johnson to Broad, FOUR runs bouncer, Broad attempts to hook it and top-edges it over the keeper for four! Johnson's not going to like that. England's lead approaching the 100 now
Johnson to Broad, no run steps a touch to leg, tries to drive - and how on earth has that missed his stumps?! He had all three to aim at, and it went over the top of middle-and-off
Johnson to Broad, 1 run a forcing back-foot drive to long-off
Johnson to Onions, (no ball) no-ball outside off
Johnson to Onions, no run beaten outside off
Johnson to Onions, no run defended on the back foot
Johnson to Onions, no run ignored outside off
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run cracked off the back foot square of the wicket. They don't take a single though
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run elegant drive to long-off. Refusing the single
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run clubbed to long-off once more. Lovely clean-striking!
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run sliced down to third man
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run bouncer, Broad misses out

Hilfenhaus to Broad, FOUR runs Broad flogs it through midwicket and they might get three. They'll get four, in fact, as the fielder palms it over the rope. Very good shot - timed it much better than anyone thought initially
Siddle to Onions, no run defended to point
Siddle to Onions, no run plays and misses outside off
Siddle to Onions, no run down the leg side. Good take by Manou who has kept very tidily, bar one or two slips. He looks solid behind the timber, though
Siddle to Onions, no run short, wide - Onions tries to cut and can't time it
Siddle to Onions, no run cuts and misses once more - great take by Manou, diving forward and snaffling it in the front of his glove
Siddle to Onions, no run sheesh that was close! Left alone and it nearly cut back into his off peg. Super leave, that
Hilfenhaus to Broad, 1 run driven out to deep extra cover and this time he does take a single
Hilfenhaus to Onions, no run got him! Five for Hilfenhaus - no! Drops just short of slip. Brilliant ball, angling in to Onions who got a thick outside edge
Hilfenhaus to Onions, 1 run nice slice from Onions past the gully
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run edged? No. I'm hearing things
Hilfenhaus to Broad, FOUR runs what a shot. A smashing pull through midwicket, bisecting two in the deep - fantastic way to bring up his fifty, and a very impressive fifty too
Hilfenhaus to Broad, FOUR runs smash. Broad's taken them apart here. A full toss, absolutely hammered back through Hilfenhaus's hands for four down the ground. He has put some hurt on that ball!
Siddle to Onions, no run defended on the back foot
Siddle to Onions, 1 run cuts back on Onions, the ball gets stuck in the pad then falls out - Broad calls him through for a single and they get it. Sleepy cricket from Australia, really

Superb knock by Broad. 55 from 64, a really impressive knock which has given England a fine lead of 113. Two hours or so left in the day's play. You can have a look at our live Hawk-Eye feed of all the important stats and graphs and so on, and we'l
Incidentally, there are 10,000 tickets available for tomorrow's fifth and final day. ?25 for adults, ?10 for under-16s. An absolute steal. Edgbaston.com is where to go.
Match drawn
Player of the match is Michael Clarke, AUS
